Docs.summary: This is a primary interface in a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this primary interface only when the method you want to use shares the same name as an event of the COM object; in this case, cast to this interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Otherwise, use the .NET interface that is derived from the COM coclass to access methods, properties, and events of the COM object. For information about the COM object, see .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent application (Outlook) for the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string BinaryToString([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function BinaryToString (Index As Object) As String

Docs.param: A 1-based index value that can be either an Integer (int in C#) value representing the column index for the collection or a String (string in C#) representing the of the Column.
Docs.summary: Obtains a String (string in C#) representing a value that has been converted from a binary value for the parent at the column specified by .
Docs.returns: A hexadecimal String (string in C#) value that has been converted from a PT_BINARY value for the parent Row at the column specified by . Returns the error, "Cannot convert the column specified by Index to String" if the value specified by is not PT_BINARY.

remarks.para: Use the helper functions Row.BinaryToString, , and to facilitate type conversion of column values at a specific row. For more information on property value representation in a , see Factors Affecting Property Value Representation in the Table and View Classes

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Class As OlObjectClass

Docs.summary: Returns a constant in the enumeration indicating the class of the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetValues() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Obtains a one-dimensional array containing the values for all columns at the in the parent .
Docs.returns: An Object that represents an array of values for all the columns at that Row in the Table.

remarks.para: GetValues is a helper method that facilitates fetching all the column values in the Row in a single call.
Since the array is zero-based, the length of the array is the number of columns in the Row minus one.

Values returned in the array are of the same type as the values in the parent Table. This means that binary properties in the Table are returned as arrays of bytes. For date-time properties, if a is a default column or if it has been added using an explicit built-in property name, then its value in the Table and in the array are expressed in local time. If the Column has been added to the Table using a namespace reference, then its value in the Table and in the array are expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). For more information on referencing properties by namespace, see Referencing Properties by Namespace

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(Index As Object) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ default[System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index); };

Docs.param: A 1-based index value that can be either an Integer (int in C#) value representing the column index for the collection or a String (string in C#) representing the of the .
Docs.summary: Obtains an Object that represents the value for the object at the column specified by .
Docs.value: An Object that represents the value of a property (as specified by ) of an item (as specified by the parent Row).

remarks.para: If a Column has been added to a using a property name referencing a namespace, you must reference the Column in the Row.Item property (this in C#) by the same namespace reference. If you use an explicit built-in name reference in Row.Item, you will get an error.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.DateTime LocalTimeToUTC([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function LocalTimeToUTC (Index As Object) As DateTime

Docs.param: A 1-based index value that can be either an Integer (int in C#) value representing the column index for the collection or a String (string in C#) representing the of the .
Docs.summary: Obtains a DateTime value in a specified by the object at , that has been converted from local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
Docs.returns: A Date value that has been converted from a representation in local time to UTC. An error is returned if is invalid or the row value indicated by is not a Date value.

remarks.para: Use the helper functions , Row.LocalTimeToUTC, and to facilitate type conversion of column values at a specific row.

For information on property value representation in a Table, see Factors Affecting Property Value Representation in the Table and View ClassesTable filters, see Filtering Items Using a Date-time Comparison

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.DateTime UTCToLocalTime([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function UTCToLocalTime (Index As Object) As DateTime

Docs.param: A 1-based index value that can be either an Integer (int in C#) value representing the column index for the collection or a String (string in C#) representing the of the .
Docs.summary: Obtains a DateTime value in a specified by the object at , that has been converted from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to local time.
Docs.returns: A Date value that has been converted from a representation in UTC to local time. An error is returned if is invalid or the row value indicated by is not a Date value.

remarks.para: Use the helper functions , , and Row.UTCToLocalTime to facilitate type conversion of column values at a specific row.
